parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
An Epicurean, one who holds the tenets of Epicurus. From Epikouros; an Epicurean or follower of Epicurus.
And, even, also, namely.
Stoic. From stoa; a 'Stoic', i.e. Adherent of a certin philosophy.
A philosopher. From philos and sophos; fond of wise things, i.e. A 'philosopher'.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From sun and ballo; to combine, i.e. to converse, consult, dispute, to consider, to aid, to join, attack.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.
This; he, she, it.
From sperma and lego; a seed-picker, i.e. a sponger, loafer.

parse: Verb - Present Optative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.
(a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb, doko dok'-o of the same meaning; to think; by implication, to seem.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A reporter, announcer, proclaimer, herald. From kataggello; a proclaimer.
Apparently a primary word; foreign; by implication, a guest or entertainer.
An evil-spirit, demon; a heathen deity. Neuter of a derivative of daimon; a d?Monic being; by extension a deity.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From eu and aggelos; to announce good news especially the gospel.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A rising again, resurrection. From anistemi; a standing up again, i.e. a resurrection from death (its author), or a recovery.
